alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 26 at 11:15AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...There is an elevated risk of flooding across Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands Friday into early next workweek... Plenty of tropical moisture and favorable upper-level conditions will bring periods of showers and thunderstorms across the local islands Friday into at least Tuesday. However, wet conditions are possible Wednesday through Friday next week. Based on the most recent guidance, most of the rainfall will fall Saturday night into Sunday. The areas most likely to receive the highest rainfall accumulations are the interior, eastern and southern sections of Puerto Rico as well as the US Virgin Islands. In these areas, there is the potential for rainfall totals of 3-8 inches through at least Tuesday. Elsewhere across Puerto Rico, rainfall totals of 3-5 inches are possible. Therefore, there is an elevated risk for widespread ponding of water, flooding of urban areas, roads and small streams. Life threatening flash flooding and mudslides are possible as well. Some rivers will likely overflow their banks. A Flash Flood Watch likely to be issued tomorrow. This product will be updated as needed. Please, continue to monitor the progress of Franklin as it moves northward across the central Caribbean.

area.areaDesc: Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas
